de.dirkgasser.brauen

Class Pump

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.dirkgasser.brauen.Pump

  • public class Pump
extends java.lang.Object
    Java class to handle a pump (or any electric motor) connected to a Raspberry Pi
    via a L298 bridge driver
    L298 inputs:

    in1 in2 ena function
    low low low off
    low low high fast stop
    high low high forward
    low high high backward
    Pin is taken as Address, so column "wPI" of "GPIO readall" command
    Class only supports soft PWM. So hart PWM gpio PIN can't be used

    • Constructor Detail

      • Pump

        public Pump(int pinena,
            int out1,
            int out2,
            com.pi4j.io.gpio.GpioController gpio)
        Parameters:
        pinena - GPIO wPI number to be connected with ENA of L298
        out1 - GPIO wPI number to be connected with IN1 of L298
        out2 - GPIO wPI number to be connected with IN2 of L298
        gpio - GpioFactory instance

        public void setOn()
        Start pump (motor) with latest PWM rate (default = 100%)

      • setOff

        public void setOff()
        stop pump (motor) with normal stop

      • setRate

        public void setRate(int rate)
        Set speed of pump (motor) via PWM rate
        if pump is not yet started, rate will be taken for next start
        Parameters:
        rate - PWM soft rate for PIN "pinena", so ENA pin of L298

      • increaseRate

        public void increaseRate(int increase)
        incriease speed of pump (motor)
        if pump is not yet started, rate will be taken for next start
        Parameters:
        increase - offset of current PWM rate for PIN "pinena", so ENA pin of L298

      • decreaseRate

        public void decreaseRate(int decrease)

        if pump is not yet started, rate will be taken for next start
        Parameters:
        decrease - - offset of current PWM rate for PIN "pinena", so ENA pin of L298
